content.en: Alzheimer's research: Scientists have used algorithms to address various research questions related to Alzheimer's disease. They have employed techniques such as genetic function approximation, docking/scoring approaches like AutoDock and FlexX, and quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) models. These algorithms have helped in identifying potential inhibitors of acetylcholinesterase, predicting chemical-protein interactions, and discovering new and more effective acetylcholinesterase inhibitors. Machine learning models have also been utilized to select potential inhibitors and predict AChE inhibitors from natural compounds. Overall, algorithms have played a crucial role in advancing research on Alzheimer's disease and developing potential treatments.
content.da: Alzheimer-forskning: Forskere har brugt algoritmer til at tackle forskellige forskningsspørgsmål relateret til Alzheimers sygdom. De har anvendt teknikker som genetisk funktionsapproksimering, docking/scoring-tilgange som AutoDock og FlexX, samt kvantitative struktur-aktivitetssammenhængsmodeller (QSAR). Disse algoritmer har hjulpet med at identificere potentielle hæmmere af acetylcholinesterase, forudsige kemiske-protein interaktioner og opdage nye og mere effektive acetylcholinesterasehæmmere. Maskinlæringsmodeller er også blevet anvendt til at udvælge potentielle hæmmere og forudsige AChE-hæmmere fra naturlige forbindelser. Samlet set har algoritmer spillet en afgørende rolle i at fremme forskningen om Alzheimers sygdom og udvikle potentielle behandlinger.
